result.execSummary:
All charges against Aazam Shan Chattha in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aazam Shan Chattha is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aazam Shan Chattha

records.addlTxt:
02:08 PM Attorney Annette E Rauch in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is deceased. Court ordered case dismissed.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Defense informs the court that the defendant is deceased. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Annette E Rauch in court by video, defendant Aazam Shan Chattha not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant is housed in Waukesha and unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pretrial Services Violation Report 
New charges filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with BEA, NAK, MMN, RJW; George Webb in New Berlin
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Aazam Shan Chattha in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Aazam Shan Chattha in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aazam Shan Chattha appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Court DISMISS "use of dangerous weapon" enhancer in Count 2.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
